meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fragile.
meanings.sent1: The fragility of the glass made it easy to break.
meanings.sent2: Handle the delicate vase with care to avoid its fragility.
meanings.sent3: The fragility of the paper was evident when it tore easily.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a crystal chandelier, beautiful but full of fragility.
meanings.sent5: The fragility of the butterfly's wings was mesmerizing as they fluttered delicately.

meanings.definition: The condition of being easily broken or damaged.
meanings.sent1: The fragility of the ancient artifact required special preservation techniques.
meanings.sent2: The fragility of the old book was evident from its torn pages.
meanings.sent3: The fragility of the phone screen was comically demonstrated when it cracked from a light tap.
meanings.sent4: The fragility of trust is like a thin thread that can easily snap.
meanings.sent5: The fragility of the ice sculpture made it a temporary masterpiece.

meanings.definition: The tendency to break or shatter easily.
meanings.sent1: The fragility of the glassware made it unsuitable for rough handling.
meanings.sent2: The fragility of the toy was evident as it broke into pieces with a slight drop.
meanings.sent3: The fragility of the cookie was amusingly demonstrated when it crumbled at the lightest touch.
meanings.sent4: The fragility of the relationship was like a thin ice layer waiting to crack.
meanings.sent5: The fragility of the snowflake made it a symbol of fleeting beauty.
